subject: Self Care
title: Naps: Power or Problem
description: Learn Naps: Power or Problem in one minute.

hook.text: NASA found that a 26-minute nap improved pilot performance by 34%. But timing is everything.

buildup.text: Short naps of 10 to 20 minutes boost alertness without entering deep sleep. You wake up sharp.

discovery.text: Naps longer than 30 minutes risk sleep inertia, that heavy, confused feeling upon waking.

twist.text: Late afternoon naps can steal from nighttime sleep, creating a cycle of poor rest and more napping.

climax.text: The ideal nap is short, early in the afternoon, and never a replacement for consistent nighttime sleep.

punchline.text: Nap briefly, nap early, or don't nap at all.

quiz.question: What is sleep inertia?
options: Heavy grogginess after waking from a deep nap
